title: How defeat was snatched from the jaws of victory as Boris Johnson finally won a Brexit vote - then had to hit pause
text:
Lyndon B Johnson famously said the first rule of politics was to learn how to count and once again Brexit became a numbers game in Westminster as MPs finally voted for a deal delivering on the referendum result - but not the timetable to deliver it by October 31.

The bizarre half-compromise came after the Prime Minister spent Tuesday feverishly texting and meeting wavering MPs in a bid to persuade them to vote for his European Union (Withdrawal Agreement) Bill (WAB).

But it soon became apparent that the ultimate test for Downing Street would not be the vote on the second reading of the proposed legislation, but the subsequent vote on the programme motion to push the WAB through both Houses...
description: Lyndon B Johnson famously said the first rule of politics was to learn how to count and once again Brexit became a numbers game in Westminster as MPs finally voted for a deal delivering on the referendum result - but not the timetable to deliver it by October 31.
